attributes.additional_details:
There's been a battle for years about GMT/BST, GMT is when the sun is highest in the sky, this is how time is co-ordinated, all international communications and travel are referenced to GMT, the line of longitude goes through greenwich, it makes sense that if we have a fixed timezone that it should be GMT For those that want to have BST, it's simple, the times to start/end the day should change, this will avoid a lot of confusion about converting time.
Please vote to keep GMT as standard UK time
(note, there is a petition to keep BST, so to be fair this one is to keep GMT)
